page.title: 15Denstone Church
page.content: The Parish Church of All Saint's Denstone was built in 1860 in Early English style.It consists of a Nave, Apsidal Chancel,Chancel and a South Porch.It is built inside and out of local Hollington stone.A low screen of stone inlaid with marble spans the church beneath the chancel arch.There are carved stalls for clergy and choir, behind the altar is reredos of alabaster and marble,sculptured with the Crucifixion.There are four bells in the belfry which are pealed calling people to worship each Sunday.The four lancet windows in the North wall are rich in coloured glass. There are three windows in the South wall and a rose window over the font.There are three services on Sundays with a congregation of about 20 people.These are led by the Vicar of Denstone.
